data.title: Wrong place with good result
data.text: After a long day of touring Dubuque my wife, our friend, & I were just looking for a neighborhood place to eat & get back home to sit & chat.  The friend we were visiting in Dubuque had been to a neighborhood Gyros place but could not recall the name.  A quick search of the internet offered Zoro.  As we walked into the restaurant, our friend reported that this w2as not the place.  About then, we were rigorously greeted by a Greek sounding & looking man.  Made to feel like old friends we each ordered our choice of gyros & were soon served.  Our food was good but made special by the thickness of the meat slices & the quantity in each serving.  It was good, the atmosphere casual, & the joyful greeting made for a good experience.

data.title: Really good food
data.text: We have been here before, but it had been a long time. We walked in and it looked like a different place. Everything was new, fresh, and looked great. The menu was smaller than it had been, but it needed that. The food and the serves were great.

data.title: Inconsistent
data.text: This is the second time I've dined at Zoro and I must say that the first time was much better. For the price, they are just OK.

data.title: Consistently good.
data.text: The food is always good, fast and served with a smile.  Refills on drinks.  My favorite is the gyro.  Haven't wanted to try anything else.

data.title: YUM.
data.text: Best post bar stop you could possibly hope for. Drop in after last call, grab a gyros and some fries, maybe chicken strips if your not really into that type of thing. You won't regret it.

data.title: Sneak up on a little greek in Dubuque
data.text: This is the only place in town you can get an anywhere near an authentic gyros.  Cut of the log with good ziti sauce. The rest of the menu is good also.  The cook is the owner and his wife is the hostess/waitress.

data.title: Authentic and Delish!
data.text: Friendly service and lots of selection if you don't love gyros.  Although, if you try one of these you may change your mind.  Located down town and one of the few that are open late.
